Author: BabyPanda265
Text: That actually sounds like a really lovely and healthy thing to do. I have a long way to go before I’m satisfied with my body, but looking back, I was a child and didn’t deserve what I went through, so maybe by honoring my past, I can have forgiveness for myself in the present. Thanks a ton! <3

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: Grief is talked about most in the context of death, but I’ve found it applies much more broadly. It’s a healthy way to process all sorts of loss, including the loss of what might have been. It could be something to consider...finding a way to honor the pain you walked through as a child, to mourn that which was missing, and to fold what you learn from that into all the moments to come. <3
